intro: Rhododendron leclerei, commonly known as the Leclère rhododendron, is a deciduous shrub native to the Himalayas. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a subtle fragrance. The plant has broad, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in whorls around the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers acidic, well-drained soil. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in temperate climates.
